hanzi-su-wiki:
脂

Значения

Жир, сало; смола, деготь

Мнемоника

Вкусная 旨 часть тела 月, жир.
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhī
fat; rouge (cosmetics); resin
толстый; румяна (косметика); смола
rtega_mnemonic:
脂脂RSfat, grease, lard, grease
  • tasty flesh 月 for a man's mouth 旨 contains a lot of fat
  • man's body 月 can get much fat if his main purpose 旨 is food
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 旨 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
脂肪 [ zhī fáng ]: fat (in the body, in a plant, or in food)
胭脂 [ yān zhī ]: rouge
树脂 [ shù zhī ]: resin
油脂 [ yóu zhī ]: grease; oil; fat
脂粉 [ zhī fěn ]: cosmetics
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right

heisig_chinese_memo: Every chef will tell you, the purpose of keeping the fat and grease is to make the meat taste delicious.
heisig_constituent: fat, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, delicious, spoon, sun, day
heisig_story: This kanji tells us that if you feed the flesh with too many delicious things, it soon picks up a thick layer of fat.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: fat, grease, tallow, lard, rosin, gum, tar
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: жир, жир, жир, сало, канифоль, смола, деготь
koohiiStory1: Every chef will tell you, fat is what make the meat taste delicious.
koohiiStory2: Fat is the most delicious part of the flesh. (Note this refers to physical fat, not the concept of obesity obese (#494)).
jp_example_words:
脂肪(しぼう): fat, grease, blubber
脂(あぶら): fat, lard
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you eat both the moon and the sun with a spoon you'll get fat. Maybe if you only ate one you could get away with it, but you wanted both and now you're pretty fat.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself digging your spoon into the moon, then into the sun, and gulping them both down. Watch your stomach swell with the sun and moon fats. No going back now, gotta finish.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Once you're nice and fat, you look in the mirror to admire your new girth. But that's not you... it's a sheep (し)!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Oh nooo you've turned into a fat sheep! You're actually pretty adorable and round and fluffy, but you liked being a human!
Ru_Meaning: fat, grease, tallow, lard, rosin, gum, tar
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 旨 (むね、うまい、シ суть; ловкость, успех; вкус).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the content (旨) of the body part (⺼) is fat
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Every chef will tell you, the purpose of keeping the fat and grease is to make the meat taste delicious.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " meat " and " purpose ", the original meaning is the fat of horned animals. "Shuowen": "The person who wears horns is fat, and the person without horns is anointed. From the flesh, the purpose is to sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The person who wears horns is fat, and the person without horns is anointed. "Dadai Yi Benming" says: "Dai Those with horns have no upper teeth." It means that cows have no upper teeth, and they don’t swallow when they touch them. "Those who don’t have horns are creamy and do not have front teeth." Those who have no horns have no upper teeth. It is fat without hind teeth." Feathers are considered as "horns", which means that the sheep belong to the genus of sheep, and the teeth prevail in the predecessor and not the latter. "Kao Gong Ji" Zheng noted: "The fat is the genus of cattle and sheep, the ointment is the hog." The note in "Nei Ze" reads: "The person who condenses is fat, and the person who releases it is ointment." Press, the person of the anointing system above is the bird of the fat system. This character is also distinguished. Those with horns and no horns have different names. The difference between this material is also. To release the ointment with fat, the poultry is also called ointment. In the "Zhou Li", the fragrant and fishy mutton are all called ointments.

After " fat ", it refers to grease. For example, "Poetry·Weifeng·Suoren": "Hands are like catkins, and skin is like fat."

" Grease " also refers to oil-like exudates, such as "Tong Dezong Jianzhong Four Years of Zizhi Tongjian": "Bulk ointment, oil pine resin reed on it"; also refers to cosmetics containing grease, especially rouge. For example, "Han Feizi·Xianxue": "Therefore, the beauty of Xishi is so good, and it is not beneficial to my noodles. If you use fat to powder and powder, it will double the original."

" Zhi " can also refer to rich salary, such as "Tai Xuan·Tong": "Exit the mud and enter the fat", Fan Wang noted: "Zhi, beautiful. It is also called Ronglu."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " meat " and " purpose ", the original meaning is the fat of horned animals.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「旨」聲，本義為有角動物的油脂。《說文》：「戴角者脂，無角者膏。从肉，旨聲。」段玉裁注：「戴角者脂，無角者膏。《大戴·易本命》曰：『戴角者無上齒。』謂牛無上齒，觸而不噬也。『無角者膏而無前齒。』謂豕屬也。無前齒者，齒盛於後不用前。『有羽者脂而無後齒。』羽當爲『角』，謂羊屬也，齒盛於前不任後。《考工記》鄭注曰：『脂者牛羊屬，膏者豕屬。』《内則》注曰：『𦘺凝者爲脂，釋者爲膏。』按，上文膏系之人，則脂系之禽，此人物之辨也。有角無角者各異其名。此物中之辨也。釋膏以脂，禽亦曰膏。《周禮》香臊腥羶皆曰膏，此皆統言不别也。」

　　「脂」後泛指油脂。如《詩·衛風·碩人》：「手如柔荑，膚如凝脂。」

　　「脂」亦指像油脂一般的滲出物，如《資治通鑑·唐德宗建中四年》：「多儲膏油松脂薪葦於其上」；也指含脂的化妝品，特指胭脂。如《韓非子·顯學》：「故善毛嬙，西施之美，無益吾面，用脂澤粉黛，則倍其初。」

　　「脂」還可以指俸祿優厚，如《太玄·童》：「出泥入脂」，范望注：「脂，美也。謂榮祿也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，「旨」聲，本義為有角動物的油脂。

從「 肉 」，「 旨 」聲，本義為有角動物的油脂。《說文》：「戴角者脂，無角者膏。从肉，旨聲。」段玉裁注：「戴角者脂，無角者膏。《大戴·易本命》曰：『戴角者無上齒。』謂牛無上齒，觸而不噬也。『無角者膏而無前齒。』謂豕屬也。無前齒者，齒盛於後不用前。『有羽者脂而無後齒。』羽當爲『角』，謂羊屬也，齒盛於前不任後。《考工記》鄭注曰：『脂者牛羊屬，膏者豕屬。』《内則》注曰：『𦘺凝者爲脂，釋者爲膏。』按，上文膏系之人，則脂系之禽，此人物之辨也。有角無角者各異其名。此物中之辨也。釋膏以脂，禽亦曰膏。《周禮》香臊腥羶皆曰膏，此皆統言不别也。」 「 脂 」後泛指油脂。如《詩·衛風·碩人》：「手如柔荑，膚如凝脂。」 「 脂 」亦指像油脂一般的滲出物，如《資治通鑑·唐德宗建中四年》：「多儲膏油松脂薪葦於其上」；也指含脂的化妝品，特指胭脂。如《韓非子·顯學》：「故善毛嬙，西施之美，無益吾面，用脂澤粉黛，則倍其初。」 「 脂 」還可以指俸祿優厚，如《太玄·童》：「出泥入脂」，范望注：「脂，美也。謂榮祿也。」
From the sound of " meat" and " purpose", the original meaning is the fat of horned animals. "Shuowen": "The person who wears horns is fat, and the person without horns is anointed. From the flesh, the purpose is to sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The person who wears horns is fat, and the person without horns is anointed. "Dadai Yi Benming" says: "Dai Those with horns have no upper teeth." It means that cows have no upper teeth, and they don’t swallow when they touch them. "Those who don’t have horns are creamy and do not have front teeth." Those who have no horns have no upper teeth. It is fat without hind teeth." Feathers are considered as "horns", which means that the sheep belong to the genus of sheep, and the teeth prevail in the predecessor and not the latter. "Kao Gong Ji" Zheng noted: "The fat is the genus of cattle and sheep, the ointment is the hog." The note in "Nei Ze" reads: "The person who condenses is fat, and the person who releases it is ointment." Press, the person of the anointing system above is the bird of the fat system. This character is also distinguished. Those with horns and no horns have different names. The difference between this material is also. To release the ointment with fat, the poultry is also called ointment. In the "Zhou Li", the fragrant and fishy mutton are all called ointments. After " fat", it refers to grease. For example, "Poetry·Weifeng·Suoren": "Hands are like catkins, and skin is like fat." " Grease" also refers to oil-like exudates, such as "Tong Dezong Jianzhong Four Years of Zizhi Tongjian": "Bulk ointment, oil pine resin reed on it"; also refers to cosmetics containing grease, especially rouge. For example, "Han Feizi·Xianxue": "Therefore, the beauty of Xishi is so good, and it is not beneficial to my noodles. If you use fat to powder and powder, it will double the original." " Zhi" can also refer to rich salary, such as "Tai Xuan·Tong": "Exit the mud and enter the fat", Fan Wang noted: "Zhi, beautiful. It is also called Ronglu."

脂字的基本解释

脂
zhī
动物体内或油料植物种子内的油质：脂肪。脂膏。松脂。脂油。香脂。
指“胭脂”：脂粉。

脂字的康熙字典解释
脂字的源字形
脂字的起名意思

动植物中所含的油质；胭脂。

fat
Basic explanation of words
fat
zhī
Oil quality in animals or oil plant seeds: fat. grease. Turpentine. Fatty oil. balsam.
Refers to "Rouge": powder.
fat
Chinese dictionary definition of words
fat
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
fat
Source glyph
fat
Name meaning
The oil contained in plants and animals; rouge.
zhī
I гл.
* смазывать жиром
脂车 смазывать колёса телеги
II сущ.
1) жир, сало (животных); жирный, сальный
2) крем; помада; румяна
脂饰 румяниться, наводить красоту
3) сок (растений), смола; соки (напр. народа)
4) довольство, роскошь
出泥入脂 попасть из нищеты в довольство
III собств.
Чжи (фамилия)
Radicals: 月, 匕, 日  (moon, spoon, sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you eat both the moon and the sun with a spoon you'll get fat. Maybe if you only ate one you could get away with it, but you wanted both and now you're pretty fat.
Picture yourself digging your spoon into the moon, then into the sun, and gulping them both down. Watch your stomach swell with the sun and moon fats. No going back now, gotta finish.
Reading Mnemonic
Once you're nice and fat, you look in the mirror to admire your new girth. But that's not you... it's a sheep (し)!
Oh nooo you've turned into a fat sheep! You're actually pretty adorable and round and fluffy, but you liked being a human!
